sub_title: Creative Marketeer and Writer, Connector, Conversations for the planet's resilience, Previously crafting journeys on the ocean
summary:
{ IN BRIEF }
As a natural communicator, I interpret the human experience through vibrant and beautiful words, supporting teams to create communities and achieve their goals beyond the layers of the day-to-day. 
I thrive in ethical and purpose-driven environments to help shape clear visions, present ideas and connect people through empathy, intuition and a mentorship approach.

{ MY PATH }
My 10 year career-cruise has allowed me to combine a background of marketing superyacht experiences with my passion for ocean conservation and conversations, wrapped in a spiritual journey of personal development.
This awakening to help protect and regenerate complex or interconnected ecosystems means I am pursuing opportunities that focus on enabling and empowering positive change through storytelling and creative content.

Close friends identify in me a caring nature, always seeking to host and gather groups of people based on common interests/values.

[{'date': {'start': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2022}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'role': 'Environmental Committee - Volunteer member', 'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'MYBA The Worldwide Yachting Association', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4D0BAQHLXrMFttNVYw/company-logo_400_400/0/1631097347083?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=VZHpBwN0B7Jwx8UPLG4mQV4KA26R5EdQzFj9N1vGp4A', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/myba-the-worldwide-yachting-association/'}, 'cause': 'ENVIRONMENT', 'description': 'Promoting an approach to yachting that respects and protects the environment is one of MYBA’s primary concerns as it recognises the scale and urgency of the issues at hand. It has recently reinforced
its commitment through the creation of an Environmental Committee. The Environmental Committee has the following charge: (1) to raise environmental awareness not only among MYBA Members but also across a broader global audience (2) to keep abreast of research and developments that pertain to the industry’s sustainability and (3) to recommend policies for adoption by the superyacht sector.'}, {'date': {'start': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}, 'end': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}}, 'role': 'Event Volunteer', 'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'Seaweed Forests Festival', 'logo': None, 'url': None}, 'cause': 'ENVIRONMENT', 'description': 'https://www.seaweedforestsfestival.com/
The first-ever festival dedicated to our magnificent underwater gardens, hosted in Sydney, Australia for 4 weeks.
Ignited a passion and belief in me with regards to the potentials of this incredible natural element.'}, {'date': {'start': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}, 'end': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2022}}, 'role': 'Marketing Committee - NSW State Representative', 'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'Superyacht Australia', 'logo': None, 'url': None}, 'cause': None, 'description': 'The committee was formed in order to position Australia as a major superyacht hub by 2023. 

One of the keys to achieving this vision is nationwide-wide collaboration on a cohesive marketing strategy. The marketing committee will be working with industry leaders to conduct further research into the superyacht sector to ensure our marketing dollars are maximised.'}, {'date': {'start': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'role': 'Coordinator', 'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'Conscious Yachties - Collaborating to inspire change', 'logo': None, 'url': None}, 'cause': 'ENVIRONMENT', 'description': 'Our Vision: To prevent overall ocean and land degradation through inspiring crew and the Yachting Industry at large to respect the environment we live in, so that we can harmoniously enjoy the beauty of a pristine ocean and a clean natural environment and sustain all species native to it.

We strive to educate, learn from, and EMPOWER yacht crew to make a difference on the seas.'}, {'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}, 'end': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2022}}, 'role': 'Volunteer', 'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'Operation Straw, And a Number of other Ocean Conservation Events', 'logo': None, 'url': None}, 'cause': 'ENVIRONMENT', 'description': 'Volunteering my time and resources to learn more about current ocean issues, connect with like-minded individuals, feel empowered about sharing the stories (digitally, yes, but also verbally) with the rest of my community, and reinforcing my search to have an impact.
Strawkle: snorkelling / freediving for straws
Seaside Scavenge: "Trash for Cash": cleaning up the ocean shores in exchange for pre-loved items.'}, {'date': {'start': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}, 'end': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}}, 'role': 'Event Partnership Manager ', 'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'Take 3 for the sea', 'logo': None, 'url': None}, 'cause': 'ENVIRONMENT', 'description': "My initiative with Take3 consisted in organising  Ocean Alliance's first edition of Sea-Through: The Superyacht Cleanup Project, which took place in Sydney Harbour in July 2017.

This was such an exciting opportunity to bring the ethics of our industry to life, and develop mindful strategies with the crew on superyachts cruising Australia towards establishing a plastic-free industry.
The initiative saw over 20,000 pieces of plastic collected from three different sites around Sydney. The company invited crew from their fleet to take part in a beach cleanup, which resulted in over 35 people joining the effort.

The beach cleanup in Sydney is just the first event, with another in the pipeline for crew who couldn’t join the most recent activities. “The result post-event was overwhelmingly positive, with crew who missed the event requesting us to host the next one closer to summer when they are back in Sydney. The beach cleanup definitely opened everyone’s eyes about the issue,” says Foulon. The initiative is in partnership with conservation group Take 3, the brainchild of marine ecologists, Roberta Dixon-Valk, Amanda Marechal and Tim Silverwood. “Tim was one of the main characters of the Australian documentary BLUE The Film, tackling ocean pollution in the South Pacific, which was partly filmed on board one of our central agency yachts – the 35m M/Y Beluga, based in Port Douglas,” she explains. 

There have been a number of high profile organisations - within the superyacht industry and beyond - who have woken up to the issues of plastic pollution, which can only be taken as a positive sign. One can’t disagree with Howard’s salient point that we cannot bite the hand that feeds us. The ocean is the life and soul of the superyacht industry, we cannot continue to ignore the threat plastic has to the environment our market depends on."}, {'date': {'start': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}, 'end': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}}, 'role': 'Volunteer', 'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'Seaside Scavenge', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C560BAQEAfC4N5oFfIg/company-logo_400_400/0/1585008015673?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=aFlDuUsmVpj55nrTmb3s_-tlJ1qxoC0dmau3BQDGhtA', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/seasidescavenge/'}, 'cause': 'ENVIRONMENT', 'description': 'Seaside Scavenge's first event in the Manly community (Sydney, Northern Beaches), SPRING INTO SCAVENGE, took place on the 8th of November with great success: 64 participants, 10 volunteers, 77kg of garbage collected.
We helped setup the area, which included a second-hand market stall, litter station, and reception area.
I was assigned to the Garbage Collection Station, where participants would drop off their cleanup; we would weigh it, and teach them about what is and is not recyclable from what they found. They then earned a "token" to exchange for pre-loved items at the "market".

***
Seaside Scavenge is a for-purpose organisation based in Sydney that harnesses
positive and collaborative approaches to inspire people, communities and businesses to
be conscious consumers. Our vision is a world where there is no waste and our mission is to to educate people globally about waste streams using fun and unique solutions that inspire participation to
clean up the ocean.
The Scavenge delivers a waterway clean up & clothes swap events where the litter that people collect becomes a currency to purchase second hand clothes, toys, books, and more that are being donated by the local community and set up in a pop-up market. The Seaside Scavenge’s ‘Trash for Cash’ concept incentivises action by appealing to people’s desire to have fun and rewards them for their effort.'}, {'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}}, 'role': 'Sailing Crew for regattas', 'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'Cruising Yacht Club of Australia', 'logo': None, 'url': None}, 'cause': None, 'description': '- Sailing crew weekly for regattas on a 52ft yacht'}]
